Explaintions.point1: A system is made up of different parts that work together to perform a specific job or function.
Explaintions.point2: Every living thing is a system made up of many parts.
Explaintions.point3: Each part in a system has its own function(s). Different parts work together to enable the system to carry out its specific function.

Explaintions.point2: Some cycles are very simple and other cycles are very complicated.
Explaintions.point3: A example of a cycle is the days of a week.

Explaintions.point1: Interaction is a kind of action that occurs as two or more objects have an effect upon one another.
Explaintions.point2: Interaction is a cause and effect

Explaintions.point1: Energy is the ability to do work, to make things happen and to cause changes.
Explaintions.point2: Energy cannot be made or destroyed; it can only be changed into different forms.
Explaintions.point3: Some examples of energy are sound, heat and light.

Explaintions.point1: There is a great variety of living and non-living things in the world
Explaintions.point2: We organise this great variety of living and non-living things to better understand the world.
Explaintions.point3: We group them by their different traits.
